Title: Information technology service performance management using COBIT and an ITIL framework: A systematic literature review
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Veronica, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Debora Suryawan, A., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Information systems play a significant role in assisting and improving a university's operational work performance. The quality of IT service is also needed to provide an information system that matches with a university's needs. As a result, evaluations need to be conducted towards IT services in fulfilling the needs and providing satisfaction for information systems users. The purpose of this paper was to conduct a synthesis of the service work performance provided by the IT Division towards information systems users by using systematic literature review. The methodology used in this research was a literature study related with a COBIT and ITIL framework, as well as finding the interrelatedness between service managements toward an increase of IT work performance. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: COBIT; IT service; ITIL; performance management; SLR; systematic literature review
Index Keywords: Information systems; Information use; COBIT; IT services; ITIL; Performance management; Systematic literature review; Information management

Title: Analysis of determining factors for successful student's GPA achievement
Source title: Proceedings - 11th 2016 International Conference on Knowledge, Information and Creativity Support Systems, KICSS 2016
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Debora Suryawan, A., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Putra, E., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Universities are required to prepare the best quality graduate. Therefore, they will be ready to contend and to be an ambitious individual in the real world. All graduates are judged by their Grade Point Average (GPA). Therefore, in Indonesia, it is critical to maintaining a good GPA from the first semester until the graduation. Although the student is the main actor, it is not only their job to maintain the GPA. The good-grade university also needs to participate by helping them to get the best help and environment during the lecture. The university should able to create conducive learning environment to support and to help undergraduate students in maintaining a good GPA. The purposes of this paper are to identify and analyze the factors that affect a good performance of student's GPA, to give suggestions to education institution as a preventive action of low performance of student's GPA, and to design a successful model to achieve good GPA. Methodologies used in this paper are literature study, analysis at the University, model trial, and giving the result and solutions. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: GPA; Grade Point Average; graduate; undergraduate students; university
Index Keywords: Computer aided instruction; Education; Education computing; Education institutions; Grade point average; graduate; Learning environments; Literature studies; Preventive action; Undergraduate students; university; Students
